channel.title: Burp Suite on
channel.description: Recent content in Burp Suite on

item.title: Burp Proxy
item.description: Burp Proxy allows us to intercept and modify requests/responses between ourselves and the target when interacting with web apps. These can then be manipulated or sent to other tools for further processing before being allowed to continue to their destination.

item.title: Burp Comparer
item.description: Burp Comparer allows us to compare two pieces of data at either word or byte level. Even though it’s not something that is unique to Burp Suite, being able to send pieces of data directly into a comparison tool with a single keyboard shortcut can speed things up considerably.

item.title: Burp Decoder
item.description: Burp Suite’s Decoder module allows us to manipulate data. We can decode information that we capture during an attack, but we can also encode data of our own, ready to be sent to the target.

item.title: Burp Extender
item.description: The Burp Suite Extender module can quickly and easily load extensions into the framework, as well as providing a marketplace to download third-party modules (referred to as the “BApp Store”).

item.title: Burp Intruder
item.description: Intruder is [[cybersecurity/knowledge/tools/burp/|Burp Suite]]’s in-built [[cybersecurity/knowledge/glossary/fuzzing]] tool. It allows us to take a request (usually captured in the [[cybersecurity/knowledge/tools/burp/proxy]] beforehand) and use it as a template to send many more requests with slightly altered values automatically.

item.title: Burp Repeater
item.description: Burp Repeater allows to take the request captured in the [[cybersecurity/knowledge/tools/burp/proxy]], edit it, and send the same request repeatedly. We can also craft and send requests by hand.

item.title: Burp Sequencer
item.description: Sequencer allows us to measure the randomness of tokens. Let’s say we wish to analyse the randomness of a session cookie or a [[cybersecurity/knowledge/glossary/CSRF]] token protecting a form submission.
